frame.name: Experience_bodily_harm
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Experiencer</fen> is involved in a bodily injury to a <fen>Body_part</fen>. (In some cases, no <fen>Body_part</fen> need be indicated.) Often an <fen>Injuring_entity</fen> on which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> injures themselves is mentioned. <ex>I think that <fex name="Exp">I</fex> <t>hurt</t> <fex name="Exp">myself</fex> <fex name="Sev">pretty bad</fex> <fex name="Place">back there</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Exp">He</fex> <t>smacked</t> <fex name="Body_part">his head</fex> <fex name="Inj_ent">on the mantel</fex> <fex name="con">getting up from poking at the fire</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_part
FE.definition: <def-root>The location on the body of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> where the bodily injury takes place. <ex>I <t>cut</t> <fex name="BodP">my finger</fex> on the envelope.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The event in which the bodily injury takes place. <ex>I <t>broke</t> my arm <fex name="con">in the accident</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Manner in which the injury takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place where the harming event occurs. <ex>She fell and <t>hit</t> her head <fex name="Place">out in the playground</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>The being or entity that is injured. <ex><fex name="Exp">The squirrel</fex> <t>abraded</t> <fex name="Exp">its</fex> tail as it twitched nervously in the confined space.</ex> <ex>Then <fex name="Exp">I</fex> <t>cut</t> <fex name="Exp">myself</fex> on an envelope.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time when the harming event occurs. <ex>So you <t>cut</t> your leg on the window frame <fex name="Time">at six o'clock</fex>, correct?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Injuring_entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> injures him/herself on an <fen>Injuring_entity</fen>.
<ex>He punched me, but he <t>hurt</t> his fist <fex name="Inj_ent">on my nose</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Severity
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is affected by the injury. <ex>The suspect <t>injured</t> his leg <fex name="Sev">severely</fex> climbing the fence.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of times that the injury happens to the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. <ex>I <t>jammed</t> my pinky on these juggling clubs <fex name="Iter">three times</fex> in the last hour.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period of time during which the Experiencer repeatedly receives bodily injuries.
<ex>Smithers <t>stubbed</t> his toe on the couch <fex name="Duration">for several months</fex> before he got used to its new location.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an experience of bodily harm.
<ex>Sue <t>stubbed</t> her toe <fex name="Frequency">three times</fex> today</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: stub.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accidentally strike (one's toe) against something.

lexUnit.name: jam.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to strike one's finger or toe resulting in injury to the joints

lexUnit.name: hit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: accidentally strike (part of one's body) against something.

lexUnit.name: hurt.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to feel pain

lexUnit.name: injure.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: do or undergo physical harm to; wound.

lexUnit.name: break.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fracture something (usually a bone), resulting in physical pain

lexUnit.name: sprain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: wrench the ligaments of (an ankle, wrist, or other joint) violently so as to cause pain and swelling but not dislocation.

lexUnit.name: strain.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: injure (a limb, muscle, or organ) by overexertion.

lexUnit.name: twist.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: force or be forced out of the natural position by a twisting action

lexUnit.name: pull.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: damage (a muscle, ligament, etc.) by abnormal strain.

lexUnit.name: tear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: damage (a muscle or ligament) by overstretching it.

lexUnit.name: cut.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to injure oneself by making an incision with a sharp object

lexUnit.name: burn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be injured due to the application of heat to one's body

lexUnit.name: smack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be struck with a sharp slap

lexUnit.name: abrade.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: scrape or wear away by friction or erosion

lexUnit.name: graze.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: scrape and break the skin on (part of the body).

lexUnit.name: bruise.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: sustain a bruise on a specified body part

lexUnit.name: scrape.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: injure by rubbing against a rough surface.

lexUnit.name: sunburn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become irritated due to exposure to the sun.

lexUnit.name: injury.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: process or instance of being physically harmed.
